column1: RFC Seraing is a Belgian association football club based in Seraing in the province of Liège. They played as Royal Boussu Dour Borinage in the Belgian Second Division from 2009–10 until promotion to the Belgian First Division B during the 2019–20 season and were formerly known as Royal Francs Borains until the start of the 2008–09 season. They play their home games at the Stade du Pairay.
The club of CS Boussu-Bois was founded in 1918 in Boussu. In 1982
column2: the club merged with CS Elouges
column3: a club from the neighbouring town of Elouges
column5: and was renamed Royal Francs Borains Boussu-Bois Elouges. In 1984–85
column8: and were promoted to the third division. At that moment
column9: they simplified their name to Royal Francs Borains. The club became a third division regular
column10: though they could not avoid relegation in 1994–95. After four seasons in the Promotion
column11: Royal Francs Borains were back to the third level
column13: they reached for the first time in their history the second level of football
column14: under their new naming of Royal Boussu Dour Borinage. In 2009–10
column15: they had their best ranking in their history
column16: with a 5th place in the second division. Their highest league ranking was a 5th place in the second division in 2009–10.

column2: Boussu Dour Borinage sold their official matricule (167) to the owners of Seraing RUL (23) and bought itself the matricule 5192 of Royal Charleroi Fleurus
column3: playing in the Belgian Fourth Division. As a result
column4: the team with matricule 167 moved to Seraing and was renamed Seraing United. It moved from the Stade Robert Urbain in Boussu to the Stade du Pairay in Seraing. The Boussu Dour-based team moved to the fourth division and was renamed Francs Borains. However
column5: the results and history of the Boussu Dour-based team remain with the matricule 167 and will be continued as Seraing United avec becomes one year later R.F.C. Seraing in tribute to the previous two city clubs.
